posts.post_content: It's not *that* difficult to use if played alongside [Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made This Card To Have The Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made This Card To Have The Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental). [Jack-in-the-Mox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jack-in-the-Mox) gets you the missing J and X, and then you use [\_\_\_\_\_](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=_____) to become an [Amulet of Quoz](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Quoz) for F, Q, and Z. Hurray!

posts.post_content: Very difficult to use. Dante80, you can't use \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ to have all 26 letters and win, according to the FAQTIWDAWCC. You have to choose a name that actually exists in Magic. Although it can be the name of a card in another language.

posts.post_content:
**Andrew's Occasional Random Card of the Day #7 - 7/3/2011 - Now I know My ABC's**  
  
Just a few days ago, as of writing this, I placed an order for some cards which I will use to assemble my [Form of the Squirrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Form of the Squirrel) deck. [Form of the Squirrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Form of the Squirrel) seems like the type of silly card that is very evocative and interesting, and has some build-around-me potential, but which is ultimately bad. They make cards like this in black borders as well, though not quite to the same degree.  
  
[Now I Know My ABC's](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Now I Know My ABC's) is obviously silly and build-around-me, but, on the surface, to me at least, seems a little more easy to 'assemble'. And when you do 'assemble' it, you win the game. I'd have to actually do a search for tons of permanents to find the right build for a deck built around this card, but it seems like doing that search and finding the right cards is the actual game this card is presenting to players. Anyway, I'd have to see an optimized deck l... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
